channel.title: dbhub.io on DB Browser for SQLite
channel.description: Recent content in dbhub.io on DB Browser for SQLite

item.title: Adding basic visualisation capability to dbhub.io
item.description: We’ve begun adding the first visualisation pieces to DBHub.io, so people can display charts from their data. eg: This is only the starting point (eg a simple vertical bar chart) while we experiment, to find a good workflow that’s easy for people to use + customise. We’re aiming to add several more chart types to choose from, and there being a selection of easy-to-use predefined templates as well. Advanced users will ideally be able to input their own SQL queries for generating the data points to visualise.

item.title: New landing page for DBHub.io
item.description: Our sister website, DBHub.io - where people can backup their databases, share them with others, and collaboratively develop data - has a proper landing page from today: Â https://dbhub.io It required quite a lot of effort to assemble, even though it’s just a simple description, screenshots (click them!), and an overview video. ðŸ˜‰ Please take a look, create an account (it’s free), and try things out. The website code is fully Open Source, and is gaining interesting + useful capabilities over time.

item.title: Standard username/password logins now working for DBHub.io
item.description: A small, but important, update about DBHub.io logins. ðŸ˜‰ People can now create accounts using their own username/password again, instead of needing to login via GitHub, Google, or LinkedIn. It used to work (ages ago), but Auth0 found a security problem with the version of NodeJS they were using, so disabled it for everyone last year. It was fixable by changing some stuff, which has now been done. On a related note… login (using username/password) only works if “3rd party cookies” aren’t blocked in your web browser.

item.title: First (beta) DBHub.io server with DB4S integration is online
item.description: The first “db4s-beta” server is now online, which DB4S 3.10.0-beta can store/retrieve databases in. Feel free to [create an account](https://db4s-beta.dbhub.io/justinclift/DB4S%20download%20stats.sqlite) and try things out (the link in the top right of that page). ðŸ˜„ Don’t store important data in it yet though, as we don’t have backups set up yet.

item.title: Initial DBHub.io server online
item.description: An initial DBHub.io server is online, running our latest development code. Testing and feedback is encouraged. Note - The data on this server will probably be wiped/reset every few days.

item.title: New sister project: DBHub.io
item.description: Added first page for our new sister project: DBHub.io. Take a look! ðŸ˜„
